title: Black Forest Cake II
description: Indulge in this classic Black Forest Cake II, a luscious chocolate layer cake soaked in Kirsch liqueur and layered with sweet cherry filling. Its rich, moist texture combined with fluffy whipped cream and chocolate curls makes it a show-stopping dessert perfect for any celebration.
ingredients: 2 (14 ounce) cans pitted Bing cherries, drained
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line the bottoms of two 8-inch round pans with parchment paper circles.
Sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and 1 teaspoon salt. Set aside.
Cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract.
Alternately beat in flour mixture and buttermilk until just combined.
Pour batter evenly into the prepared pans.
Bake for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Cool cakes completely, then remove parchment paper.
Cut each cake layer in half horizontally to make 4 layers total.
Sprinkle each layer evenly with 1/2 cup kirschwasser.
In a medium bowl, cream butter until light and fluffy. Add confectioners' sugar, pinch of salt, and brewed coffee; beat until smooth. If too thick, add a couple teaspoons of cherry juice or milk.
Spread one-third of the buttercream filling over the first cake layer, then top with one-third of the drained cherries. Repeat for remaining layers.
In a separate bowl, whip heavy cream to stiff peaks. Beat in 1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract and 1 tablespoon kirschwasser.
Frost the top and sides of the cake with the whipped cream mixture.
Use a potato peeler to shave curls from the semisweet chocolate and sprinkle over the cake for decoration.
tips: For the best texture, ensure the butter and shortening are at room temperature before creaming. When cutting the cake layers, use a serrated knife and a gentle sawing motion to keep layers even. Soaking the layers with kirschwasser adds moisture and authentic flavor—don’t skip this step. Chill the cake for at least an hour before serving to allow flavors to meld and frosting to set.

structured_content.content: This Black Forest Cake II is a decadent celebration of rich chocolate and bright cherry flavors, layered with fluffy cream and kissed by a splash of kirschwasser. The moist cake layers soak up the liqueur, creating a symphony of textures and tastes that delight every bite. Its striking appearance with chocolate curls and vibrant cherries makes it a centerpiece dessert that’s as beautiful as it is delicious.

structured_content.content: I first made this Black Forest Cake for a family birthday, and the rich chocolate aroma combined with the sweet cherry filling instantly brought back nostalgic memories. Watching everyone’s faces light up with each bite reminded me why this classic dessert remains a beloved favorite across generations.

• Main ingredient: High-quality all-purpose flour and unsweetened cocoa powder create a tender, deeply chocolatey cake; be sure to sift them well for a smooth batter.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Kirschwasser adds authentic cherry liqueur flavor that soaks into the cake layers, elevating the taste beyond ordinary chocolate cake.
  • Supporting ingredients: Pitted Bing cherries provide juicy bursts of sweetness, while buttermilk keeps the cake moist and tender.
  • Equipment needed: Two 8-inch round cake pans, parchment paper, mixing bowls, electric mixer, serrated knife for layering, and a potato peeler for chocolate curls.

Preparation:
Preheat your oven and prepare pans with parchment paper. Sift dry ingredients to ensure even mixing. Cream shortening and sugar until fluffy, then incorporate eggs and vanilla for a smooth base. Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to maintain a tender crumb.
Cooking/Baking Process:
Bake the batter until a toothpick comes out clean, signaling perfect doneness. Cool completely before slicing to avoid crumbling. Carefully slice each cake horizontally to create four even layers. Sprinkle kirschwasser evenly to infuse moisture and flavor.
Finishing Touches:
Prepare the buttercream filling with butter, confectioners’ sugar, coffee, and a pinch of salt for balance. Layer the cake with filling and cherries, then whip cream with vanilla and kirschwasser for a light, fluffy frosting. Decorate with chocolate curls for an elegant finish.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Use room temperature butter and shortening for smooth creaming.
  • Avoid overbaking to keep the cake moist and tender.
  • The cake is ready when a toothpick inserted comes out clean without wet batter.
  • Store covered in the refrigerator for up to 3 days; bring to room temperature before serving.

structured_content.content: Sharing this cake with loved ones has always been a joyous occasion, whether for birthdays or festive gatherings. The combination of chocolate, cherries, and cream never fails to bring smiles and create lasting memories around the table.

Enhance the cherry flavor by adding a teaspoon of cherry extract to the whipped cream frosting. For a richer chocolate experience, fold in finely chopped dark chocolate into the buttercream filling. Toasted almonds or hazelnuts sprinkled between layers add a delightful crunch and nutty contrast.

Serve slices with a scoop of vanilla ice cream or a drizzle of warm chocolate sauce for extra indulgence. Pair with a glass of chilled sparkling wine or coffee for a perfect dessert experience. This cake shines at holiday dinners, romantic occasions, or elegant afternoon teas.

For a gluten-free version, substitute all-purpose flour with a gluten-free baking blend. Vegan bakers can replace eggs with flaxseed meal and use coconut cream instead of heavy cream for frosting. Swap kirschwasser with cherry juice or brandy for a non-alcoholic alternative that still delivers great flavor.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• Chill the cake layers before slicing to achieve clean, even cuts.
  • Use a serrated knife with a gentle sawing motion to prevent crumbling.
  • Whip cream just until stiff peaks form to avoid overbeating and curdling.
  • Decorate with freshly shaved chocolate curls for a professional look.

structured_content.content: With a little patience and love, this Black Forest Cake II will become your go-to dessert for impressing friends and family. Enjoy every rich, creamy, cherry-filled bite and the joy of creating a timeless classic in your own kitchen.
